# Mlogit

## Data prep

```{r}
load("data/ess.Rdata")

mlogit_ess <- ess 


#pacman::p_install_gh("systats/binoculaR")
library(rstan)
binoculaR::binoculaR(ess)

var_label(ess$imueclt)

# rstan_options(auto_write=TRUE)
# options(mc.cores=parallel::detectCores ()) # Run on multiple cores


mlogit_ess <- ess %>% 
  mutate(target = as.factor(target)) %>% 
  drop_na(target) %>% 
  mutate(cltre_ndrmnd = 10 - imueclt) %>% 
  mutate(stsfd_econ = 10 - stfeco) %>% 
  rename(
    demsat = stfdem,
    age = agea,
#    year = inwyys,
    trust_gov = trstplt,
    trust_parliament = trstprl,
    trust_police = trstplc,
    trust_courts = trstlgl
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    income = 5 - hincfel,
    educ = Recode(
      eisced,
      "55 = NA"
    ),
    work = ifelse(mnactic == 1, 1, 0),
    sex = gndr - 1 # sex variable erstellen
  ) %>% 
  select(demsat, age, income, educ, work, sex, trust_gov,
         cltre_ndrmnd, stsfd_econ, target, pweight) %>% 
  na.omit()
```

# Modeling

```{r}


set.seed(3875)

### With improper prior it takes about 12 minutes, with about 40% CPU utilization and fans running,
### so you probably don't want to casually run the next line...

library(nnet)
mlogit_ess$populism2 <- relevel(mlogit_ess$target, ref = "Establishment")
test <- multinom(populism2 ~ cltre_ndrmnd + stsfd_econ + demsat + trust_gov + 
                   age + educ + income + work + sex +
                 cltre_ndrmnd*stsfd_econ, data = mlogit_ess, weights = pweight)

screenreg(test)
stargazer::stargazer(test, type="text")

multi1.rrr <- exp(coef(test))

stargazer::stargazer(test, type="text",coef=list(multi1.rrr), p.auto=FALSE)

summary(test)

head(pp <- fitted(test))

broom::tidy(test)

probs <- pp %>% 
  as_tibble() %>% 
  cbind(mlogit_ess) #%>%

plot_probs <- function(probs, variable) {
  ss <- probs %>% 
  mutate(variable = as.numeric(variable)) %>% 
  select(variable, `Illiberal Populism`, `Liberal Populism`, Establishment) %>% 
#  mutate(id = n()) %>% 
  gather(key = variable)  

names(ss) <- c("variable", "type", "value")


ss %>% 
   ggplot(aes(variable, value, colour = type)) +
   geom_smooth(method = "loess") +
   labs(x = names(ss)[1]) +
  ggthemes::theme_fivethirtyeight() +
  ggthemes::scale_color_fivethirtyeight()
}

plot_probs(probs, probs$demsat)



ss <- probs %>% 
  mutate(stsfd_econ = as.numeric(stsfd_econ)) %>% 
  select(stsfd_econ, `Illiberal Populism`, `Liberal Populism`, Establishment) %>% 
#  mutate(id = n()) %>% 
  gather(key = stsfd_econ)  

 # 
names(ss) <- c("stsfd_econ", "type", "value")


ss %>% 
   ggplot(aes(stsfd_econ, value, colour = type)) +
   geom_smooth()

```



```{r}

p <- predict(test)
table(p)
z <- summary(test)$coefficients/summary(test)$standard.errors
z

# 2-tailed z test
p <- (1 - pnorm(abs(z), 0, 1)) * 2
p

## extract the coefficients from the model and exponentiate
exp(coef(test))

head(pp <- fitted(test))

library(mlogit)
m <- mlogit(populism2 ~ cltre_ndrmnd, data = mlogit_ess)
# compute a data.frame containing the mean value of the covariates in the sample
z <- with(mlogit_ess, data.frame(price = tapply(price, index(m)$alt, mean), 
	catch = tapply(catch, index(m)$alt, mean), 
income = mean(income)))
# compute the marginal effects (the second one is an elasticity
effects(m, covariate = "income", data = z)
effects(m, covariate = "price", type = "rr", data = z)
effects(m, covariate = "catch", type = "ar", data = z)

library(mnlogit)
#data(Fish, package = "mnlogit")
fm <- formula(populism2 ~ cltre_ndrmnd )
fit <- mnlogit(fm, mlogit_ess, choiceVar="Establishment", ncores = 2)

system.time (b1 <- brm (populism ~ cltre_ndrmnd, 
                        data=mlogit_ess,
                        family="categorical", 
                        n.chains=3, 
                        n.iter=3000, 
                        n.warmup=600))
```
